description: The shade of this Kathy Joseph creation is that of rosé-colored sunglasses. Such comfort is furthered with a cherry cola and maraschino cherry nose. A slight effervescent zing on the palate accompanies pomegranate flavors followed by an impressively long finish. Great with a fresh garden salad, but able to handle more substantial fare too, such as  breaded chicken cutlets or a cheeseburger.

title: Blair 2012 Delfina's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: There's s great story about five generations behind this wine, which offers a nose fresh and clean with raspberry, cranberry and crushed clove. The flavors are lean, with steel, graphite and raspberry, perfect for serving with a wide variety of foods.

title: Donelan 2012 Two Brothers Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: Light in color with an herbal profile, this lightly textured wine offers tart cherry and dry tannins with a bite of oak on the finish. Having undergone partial whole-cluster fermentation (30%), it also has a forested, savory character, streaked in cedar and baking spice. Most of the grapes hail from Sonoma Mountain, rounded out by Sonoma Coast, Russian River Valley and Mendocino fruit.

title: R2 2012 Black Pine Pinot Noir (California)
description: A medium-bodied Pinot Noir that is quite sophisticated, despite the California AVA labeling. It has lots of cherry-berry flavors, great balance, velvety texture and long finish. It is substantial in flavor, smooth, and complete.

title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Prestige Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: Mostly Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this blend includes smaller percentages of Pinot Meunier and Pinot Gris as well. Light golden in color, it's a zingy, long-lingering taste of citrus and berry that's creamy on the palate with a floral nose.

title: Equinox 2001 Blanc De Blanc Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This wine doesn't reveal much age at all, with fresh golden pear and tangerine rind aromas punched up with a hint of sour yeast. The yeast dominates the palate, though orange and rounded melon tones add to the full experience.

title: Equinox NV Blanc de Blanc Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Aromas of toast, green apple and underripe pear waft from this straight-ahead bubbly from a sparkling-focused winery on the Westside of Santa Cruz. Golden apple, lemon-lime and yeastiness carry the palate, with a touch of lemon cream.

title: Gary Farrell 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This structured rosé packs a punch in tannins at first, but is balanced and dry. Refreshing bursts of wild berries and savory herb lead to a smooth and exotic finish. The subtle power reflects the vintage and Green Valley-sourced vineyards.

title: Breathless NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)
description: Made entirely from Pinot Noir grapes, this méthode Champenoise sparkler is golden peach in color with attractive aromas and flavors of orange blossom, hazelnut, orange peel and a slight sense of garden herbs. Dry, it makes for a nice wine on its own or in spritzers.

title: Bruliam 2012 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This wine opens with very flinty aromas of struck graphite and pencil shavings, with touches of fermenting orange and cranberry. It's light in weight but darkly flavored on the palate, with slate and clove spice.

title: Bodkin NV Extra Dry Cuvee Januariis Blanc de Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: A slightly different flavor spectrum makes this pale-colored, lean and crisp sparkling wine stand out. With notes of honeydew melon and cucumber, and great balance from juicy acidity, it tastes slightly sweet and as refreshing as those fruit descriptors would suggest.
designation: Extra Dry Cuvee Januariis Blanc de

title: Mansfield-Dunne 2012 Peterson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This wine's nose has a sharply spiced tinge, with wet herbs, cola, and cranberry aromas. At first, it's a bit muddy on the palate, but then the strong acidic backbone presents both herbal tones and tart cranberry against an earthy core.

title: Rusack 2012 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Violets and rose petals lead the nose, followed by ripe blackberries and, with a bit of patience, some warm pie crust. The flavors are pleasant but hard to pin down, with flashes of licorice, red currant, allspice and orange peel.

title: McFadden NV Cuvee Brut Rosé Sparkling (Potter Valley)
description: Ripe fruit flavors and an easy but refined foamy texture make this light salmon-colored bubbly taste generous, complete, fruity and fresh. A touch of sweetness in the cherry and berry flavors keep the impression smooth and the flavors fruity through the finish.

title: Mirabelle NV Brut Sparkling (California)
description: A brassy color and generous fruit flavors define this rich, dry and sophisticated bubbly. It has vivid cherry and white peach flavors, a smooth effervescence, crisp acidity and a lingering finish.

title: Fess Parker 2012 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This winery produces a slew of Pinot Noirs each year, and this specific clonal study shows clove and cardamom on the somewhat subdued nose. The flavors are more forward, dominated by black tea and cherry, with a touch of tannin.

title: La Follette 2012 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earth and mushroom dominate this lighter-style wine, offering aromas and flavors of forest floor and fresh soil, and even a taste of black tea shyly dancing in the background. Well-balanced and complex, it has a silky texture and long, smooth finish.

title: Mumm Napa 2009 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: Brilliant golden hay in color, this is a dry, intense sparkler, made from 75% Chardonnay and 25% Pinot Gris. It offers complex highlights of lemon and apple on the palate with plenty of minerality.

title: Laetitia 2011 Brut Rose Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: For a pink sparkler, there's not a lot of fruit on the nose, which is carried by crisp yeastiness instead. There are lovely bubbles on the palate, full of crisp red apple and lemon citrus flavors that enliven all of the senses. This is a perfect apéritif wine.

title: Laetitia NV Brut Cuvee Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This blend of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc presents a very pretty nose of nectarine, yeast and chalk. The stone fruit flavors persist on the palate, kicked up by white flowers and lime juice.

title: Fiddlehead Cellars 2010 Seven Hundred Twenty Eight Bubbles Blanc De Noir Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a touch of tuberose on the nose of this sparkling wine from Kathy Joseph's estate, located at mile marker 728 Santa Rosa Road. Green apples carry the palate from front to back, spiced up with a bit of salinity.
designation: Seven Hundred Twenty Eight Bubbles Blanc De Noir

title: Lombardi 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Crafted from Wente clone grapes from Charles Ranch, this label is the passion project of longtime wine industry player Tony Lombardi, who manages the much larger Kosta Browne brand. Barrel-fermented in neutral oak this wine offers heady Tahitian vanilla and lemon curd around green apple skin and lemon. The palate is both creamy and crisp, the finish reasonably powerful.

title: Martin Lane Winery 2010 Estate Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: Still tight and young, this tastes like a keeper that will improve with time. Aged in all new American barrels, it shows aromas of coriander, cumin and smoke, with flavors like black cherry and black pepper. It balances well between firm tannins, good acidity and full flavors, and everything sails through the finish. Best after 2018.

title: Chasseur 2012 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Fully creamy and generous in crème brûlée and lemon curd, this dances in acidity and is balanced, the texture silky smooth. Highlights center on fresh-cut Anjou pear, a slice of which would go well with the wine, accompanied by Stilton.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2013 Vintner's Reserve Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a tasty and accessibly priced Chardonnay. It packs in lots of fruit flavor, vibrant acidity, rich texture and layers of oaky spice while showing a rare sense of seamlessness. Very Californian and compelling.

title: Anglim 2010 Best Barrel Blend Syrah-Mourvèdre (Paso Robles)
description: Very appealing aromas of warm strawberry-cherry pie, red licorice and red rose promise ripe juiciness in this nearly equal blend of Syrah and Mourvèdre. The palate delivers with cherry cola, and the wine almost seems sweet, yet is bone dry, with nice grippy tannins as well.

title: Diamond Creek 2011 Gravelly Meadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the winery's most pebbly five-acre section of vineyard atop Diamond Mountain, this is dark black-purple in color. The tannins are soft but powerful, eager to age through 2025–2027, while the fruit lies on the currant and plum side of things, with a bit of cedar lurking through.

title: Paratus 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: From an estate vineyard high atop Mount Veeder, this 100% Cabernet Sauvignon is dark and inky, concentrated in color and flavor, a brambly intensity at the center of it all. Peppercorns and clove accent its larger smoky, espresso side, the body full and velvety.

title: VML 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Grapefruit rind jumps out of the glass in this vivid, balanced and refreshing white that also carries a complex mix of lime, more grapefruit and the tiniest suggestion of fresh-cut grass. A creaminess to the texture rounds things out and soothes the edges.

title: Pianetta 2011 Sangiovese (Paso Robles)
description: Distinct and delicious aromas of crème brûlée with a strawberry glaze pick up some licorice and dark spice when digging deeper. The cranberry fruit's tartness, tannins, and acidity make for a mouth-rinsing wine. Serve with hearty pasta or rich meats.

title: Transcendence 2012 Harrison Clarke Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Deep and rich aromas of blackberry syrup and wet slate kick off this excellent, approachable representation of Santa Barbara County's new Ballard Canyon appellation. It's both juicy and tannic once sipped, tasty with blackberry and slight cherry juice. Balanced with medium-range force, it provides evidence of how the region evens out Syrah's rougher edges.

title: Sextant 2011 Kamal Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Sharp anise, violet and menthol scents swirl around a core of rich blackberry jam on this wine, hitting the palate with serious thickness. The Kamal, named after an 8th-century navigation device, also features the other four Bordeaux varietals. It delivers flavors of deep plum jelly, cherry syrup, pepper and cedar.

title: Talley 2012 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: A sharp brine character gets warmer boosts from underlying pear, nectarine and buttered sourdough aromas. Flavors are light and bright at first, with sandy clay, vanilla cookie and custard strudel emerging on the midpalate and a line of acidity down through the finish.

title: Starfield 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This juicy, minerally blend is composed of 78% Cabernet Sauvignon and 22% Merlot. The winery aims to source from cool vineyard sites and this bottling is true to that in style—elegant and balanced, subtle in tannins and aged in only 50% new oak. Bay leaf and mint come to the fore ahead of clove.

title: Red Mare 2012 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: High-toned acidity rules the day here, the wine a tempting mélange of fresh grapefruit, lemon and apple, the texture smooth and succulent. The flavors are long lasting and complex.

title: Robert Biale 2012 Old Kraft Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)
description: Soft, subdued, savory and subtle, Old Kraft dates back originally to the 1860s, much of its plantings traceable to the 1890s. Zinfandel and Petite Sirah populate the gorgeous pocket of a site, a stone's throw from Spottswoode. Blackberries and raspberries figure prominently, alongside intrigues of cinnamon and clove, a forested note not far behind.

title: Carica 2010 Kick Ranch Siren Red (Sonoma County)
description: Black olive dominates on the nose in this blend of 75% Syrah, 12.5% Grenache and 12.5% Mourvèdre, all from Kick Ranch. Lively red fruit is amplified by soft, medium-bodied tannins and a well-composed finish, with just enough earth and spice to go around.

title: Brown Estate 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: From the well-known Zinfandel producer, this floral Chardonnay is high in balanced minerality and marked by darker, riper pear and apple fruit. The finish is swathed in vanilla bean and toast.

title: Calluna 2010 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Chalk Hill)
description: Among the first vintages from a small, family-run vineyard and winery within the Chalk Hill AVA, this also contains small amounts of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec, all estate-grown. The wine is soft and medium-bodied, brooding in savory leather and herb.

title: Clos La Chance 2012 Murphy's Choice Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: A pleasant aromatic mix of sweet buttercream with salted caramel join with pineapple and guava on this wine from the hills above Silicon Valley. It is nicely rounded on the palate, with pear, apple and more guava leading to a yeasty, acidic finish.

title: Core Winery 2009 Elevation Sensation Alta Mesa Vineyard Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is a barrel-aged, punch-in-the-face blend of 62% Grenache and 38% Mourvèdre from Santa Maria-based winemaker Dave Corey, who sources most of his fruit from the Cuyama Valley. Its cherry syrup nose dives into a thick, juicy palate, heavily spiced with tobacco, laden with chalky tannins and ending with vanilla.

title: Burnside Road 2013 Mid-Day Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Made from Zinfandel, Primitivo, Petite Sirah and Pinot Noir, this salmon-colored rosé is satisfying in apricot and pineapple fruit tones, with an herbal finish and light body.

title: Caliza 2012 Sidekick Roussanne-Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: An ever-so-slight astringency greets the nose on this 60% Rousanne-40% Viognier blend, with buttered apple and burned lemon aromas most prevalent. Apple leads the very even, almost subdued palate, perfect to pair with fruit salad to kick off a summer picnic.

title: Clos La Chance 2013 Hadley's Cuvée Estate White (Central Coast)
description: Rounded aromas of melon, lemon, apple and a touch of passionfruit frame the nose on this blend of 70% Viognier, 20% Grenache Noir and 10% Chardonnay. Good acidity wraps flavors of honeydew, guava and smoked nectarine drizzled in honey.

title: Ferguson Crest 2010 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: The Black Eyed Peas' singer Fergie and renowned winemaker Joey Tensley present an in-your-face Viognier, deeply yellow, nearing brown in color, with aromas of dried apricot, honey-roasted nuts and smoky mezcal with lime. Lush flavors of burnt orange peel, smoke and Scotch whisky make for an intriguing drink, certainly not for those seeking a dainty white wine.

title: First Press 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Offering great value white, this is 90% Sauvignon Blanc with 10% Sémillon. It's bright and intensely flavored, first with pineapple followed by a flash of grapefruit and layering of vanilla. A crowd pleaser and food-friendly quaff.

title: Dunstan 2013 Durell Vineyard Rosé (Sonoma Coast)
description: The only rosé made from Durell Vineyard, this one employs 100% Pinot Noir for a subtle, light, dry wine that's refreshing in strawberry and peach. Having spent six months in neutral French oak, it's structured and midweight, just right for the table.

title: Spann Vineyards 2011 Cross Creek Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: A 100% Cabernet Sauvignon from one of Sonoma County's newest appellations, a district that spans Sonoma Valley's eastern ridges near Napa's Mount Veeder. Cross Creek Vineyard has long been the source for this winery's Cab, a fresh, juicy taste of black fruit with managed tannins and hints of mint chocolate.

title: Rock Wren 2010 Syrah (Solano County)
description: Intense tannins and full body make this Syrah difficult to savor at this point, but it may round out with aging. It smells like smoke and black pepper, and tastes like grilled beef and blackberries. It is firm and astringent in texture, tight and concentrated in flavor. Best after 2018.

title: V. Sattui 2011 Syrah (Napa Valley)
description: This wine also contains small percentages of Petite Sirah and Grenache to good effect, providing a soft and approachable entry of well-balanced black fruit and leather.

title: Kokomo 2013 Timber Crest Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Fermented in both tank and new acacia barrels, there's definitely a depth of woodiness on the opening aromas. This is followed by a creaminess of texture on the palate, the taste leaning toward pear, vanilla and fresh melon. The finish is first creamy, then crisp, veering on spritzy.

title: La Crema 2013 Pinot Gris (Monterey)
description: Brisk nectarine and just a touch of apple frame the nose, and warmer, expressive flavors of peach make for a perfect poolside beverage.

title: Muscardini 2013 Alice's Vineyards Rosato di Sangiovese (Sonoma Valley)
description: Ripe in strawberry and pineapple and dark pinkish-orange in color, this is straightforward and dry. Smooth and tangy to drink, it's accented in a citrus finish akin to fresh-pressed juice.

title: Truett Hurst 2013 Bluebird Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Nutty and zesty in mouthcoating, tingling acidity, this features a depth of grassiness and lime. It has just enough heft on the palate to be enjoyed alone or with spicy Mexican food like chilequiles.

title: Sextant 2012 Estate Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This is lean on the nose, with tart apple and just a touch of white flowers. There's more to the palate—citrus pith bitterness, thyme-like herbs, apple juice—but it's the acidic focus is laser-like, and not lush at all.

title: Summerwood 2010 Sentio Red (Paso Robles)
description: The nose on this blend of 44% Cabernet Sauvignon, 43% Petit Verdot and 13% Merlot is slow to emerge, with cedar, slate and dark fruit eventually arising. Cedar is also prominent on the palate, along with graphite, espresso and earthiness.

title: Turchi 2007 Santa Barbara Highlands Super Duper Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)
description: Although the wine is seven years old, the tannic structure and tremendous grip remain overwhelming. It smells of balsamic vinegar, smoked tobacco, anise and black currant before delivering flavors of sweet tobacco and molasses. It's chewy and barely drinkable now, so hold until 2020.
designation: Santa Barbara Highlands Super Duper Reserve

title: Deep Sea 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Warm notes of leather mixed with cherry lozenge fruitiness and cigar ash lead the nose on this bottling from Deep Sea, whose tasting room on Santa Barbara's wharf offers tremendous views. The flavor is blackberry with an herbal lift and a tad of licorice, and the mouthfeel is more lean than lush.

title: Noble Vines 2012 1 Red (California)
description: It's easy to like the breadth and depth of ripe fruit flavor in this full-bodied wine. It tastes like cherries and dark plums, feels smooth but nicely tannic and has a lingering finish of baking spices. Big enough for your heftiest dishes.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2011 Petit Verdot (Howell Mountain)
description: Dusty and juicy, this is firmly structured and spicy in blackberry and pepper. The finish builds up to an afterthought of coffee and dark chocolate, accompanied by a distant cigar.

title: Byington 2013 Ventana Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: From a winery based in the Santa Cruz Mountains, this Monterey wine features a delicate nose of chives, white flowers, pear and cut grass. It's fresh but brief on the palate, with limestone minerality, and a little dill on the finish.

title: Easton 2011 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Light in color, smooth, soft with a trace of astringency to the background, it shows off Barbera's marriage of acidity and denseness. It's a heavier version for sure, with spice and rustic black cherry.

title: Wente 2011 Southern Hills Cabernet Sauvignon (San Francisco Bay-Livermore Valley)
description: Light in savory cranberry and a subdued hint of olive, this medium-bodied Cabernet is soft and ready to drink now. With moderate tannins and more red fruit than black, it will pair easily with meals.

title: Harmonique 2007 The Noble One Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Muted aromatically, it has a light, bright core of cherry lurking in the layers of juicy spice. The grapes come from the Klindt and Wiley Vineyards. Let it breathe or decant before drinking, and enjoy it soon.

title: Golden 2010 Coro Mendocino Red (Mendocino)
description: Comprised of 50% Zinfandel, 27% Syrah and 23% Petite Sirah. Made from Demeter-certified biodynamic grapes, this blend opens with aromas of candied dried fruit and violets before offering a darker fruit profile and quite-present tannins. It has a harsh finish.

title: Macchia 2011 Bodacious Petite Sirah (Amador County)
description: Steeped in smoky black fruit, this is a chewier version of Petite, ripe and meaty, black as night. Amid the ripe black fruit, a flash of red fruit midway through a taste leads to the big, tannic finish.

title: La Marea 2013 Kristy Vineyard Albariño (Monterey County)
description: Aromas of ripe ruby-red grapefruit mix with scents of wet sand in this stainless-steel and cold-fermented white. It delivers plush melon, citrus and a bit of bubble gum on the palate before ceding to powerful acidity. There is perhaps something disjointed in the ripe fruit flavors meeting up with bracing acidity, but it's a memorable sipper nonetheless.

title: Las Positas 2012 Buttner Sunol Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Livermore Valley)
description: This substantial wine is replete with apricot and a faint lurking of herb. The acidity is there, just faintly, racing through to the finish.

title: Cookies & Cream 2012 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Smooth and appealing, with ample fresh citrus flavors and a supple mouthfeel, this isn't so assertive that it gets in the way of the conversation or the food. Sourcing good quality grapes from non-premier regions keeps the price down.

title: Concannon 2010 Nina's Cuvée Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: With a strong undercurrent of bell pepper, this soft Petite Sirah has tense shadings of peppery spice and leather. Ready to drink now.

title: Orfila 2011 Estate Sangiovese
description: Dusty in tannins and rustic cherry fruit, this leathery, mocha-tinged Sangiovese has just the right seasoning of smoky spice that finishes lean. Big-shouldered at 15.6% alcohol, it's one to enjoy slowly and with food.

title: Peirano 2012 The Heritage Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Bright in acidity and soft in texture, it offers cassis, pomegranate and tart cherry before finishing with a note of chocolate, more milk than dark.

title: Helwig 2013 Rosé de Shenandoah Rosé (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Think of a pink version of Beaujolais Nouveau. The grapy flavors light up this light-bodied, extroverted rosé even more than the almost fluorescent pink color. Very fresh, light and frothy and all those qualities seem right for it.

title: Baileyana 2012 Firepeak Estate Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Coming in at the less-oaked end of the California Chardonnay scale, this presents aromas of slate, graphite and cut grass. It delivers those same flavors to the palate as well as some green pear. It's restrained, yet still New World.

title: Firestone 2012 Riesling (Central Coast)
description: Bright smells of freshly shredded lemongrass and orange blossom lift off of this Riesling that gets an aromatic boost from 11% Gewürztraminer. On the palate, it is smooth but slightly sweet, with orange soda flavors and a nice herbal twist of chamomile tea.

title: Wente 2011 The Art of Giving Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Made to benefit the Wente Foundation for Arts Education, this wine is made in small quantities. It is juicy and leathery, soft, structured and medium-bodied with a long finish of tar and tannin.

title: Claudia Springs 2010 Coro Mendocino Red (Mendocino)
description: Comprised of 41% Zinfandel, 32% Primitivo, 10% Petite Sirah, 10% Grenache and 7% Carignane. Grenache and Carignane contribute juicy red fruit to the blend. Amidst it all are integrated tannins, a touch of toffee-chocolate and a big, ripe finish.

title: Saint Gregory 2010 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: Light in color and barely-there aromas, this fine-tuned Pinot is faint in raspberry fruit. Soft and textured, the finish is quick. Priced fairly, it makes a nice choice for larger gatherings.

title: Terre Rouge 2011 Les Côtes de l'Ouest Syrah (California)
description: A remarkable wine for under $20, well made and varietally defined in cinnamon, white pepper and gamy red fruit.

title: Castle Rock 2012 Pinot Grigio (Monterey County)
description: Pungent jasmine and orange blossom take hold of the nose right away, ensuring that this won't be one of those flavorless Pinot Grigios to forget. On the palate, roasted pear and slight toffee tones mingle with lemon-lime acidity, making this wine a nice fit for backyard gatherings featuring shrimp on the barbie.

title: Cookies & Cream 2012 Chardonnay (California)
description: This rich and buttery Chardonnay is made in a classic California style. Its smooth texture coats the palate and helps the generous pear and pineapple flavors linger on a slightly sweet finish.

title: Cedar Mountain 2009 Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Generous in white pepper, particularly on the nose, this Petite has tight, puckering tannins pleading for more time in the bottle. Soft flavors lean to the leathery blackberry and licorice side of things.

title: Michael David 2012 Incognito White (Lodi)
description: This mélange of mostly Viognier and Chardonnay also holds smaller percentages of Sauvignon Blanc, Symphony and Muscat. Incognito spent no time in oak. With a lively taste of orange blossom, it could almost be mistaken for Gewürztraminer because of its distinct mixture of floral and spice.

title: Vindemia 2008 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)
description: Smoky in leathery barrel flavor, this soft Cabernet Franc comes with layers of herb and red currant that are modest in alcohol and tannins. Those flavors will be piqued when paired with chicken pot pie or a pizza topped in bell pepper and olive.

title: Enotria 2010 Barbera (Mendocino County)
description: This toasty Barbera has small amounts of Syrah and Carignane blended in, giving it a dryness that somewhat overshadows the fruit, which is more ripe blackberry than anything else. A good go-to for pizza night; drink it slightly chilled and soon.

title: Fenestra 2009 Tempranillo (Livermore Valley)
description: An oaky, smooth Tempranillo with understated black cherry and earthy notes, soft and medium-bodied. On the finish, expect vanilla.

title: Fenestra 2010 Ghielmetti Vineyard Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: The wine offers a taste of cherry liqueur and blueberries that's soft, high in acidity and still a bit tight in tannins. This would be a good one to give a bit more time.

title: Rack & Riddle NV Brut Sparkling (North Coast)
description: A Brut made from 45% Chardonnay, 42% Pinot Noir and 13% Sauvignon Blanc, this nonvintage sparkler is salmon in color and creamy on first pour. Crisp with a long finish, the flavors that dominate involve apple and Asian pear.

title: Harmonique 2008 Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: This older vintage Chardonnay has a flinty, saline quality to it and a faint taste of waxy apple. Medium in body, it's savory and surrounded by citrus tones with a high note of acidity. Clean and integrated it's a nice reminder of how Chardonnay can be just as fresh and alive five years on as upon first release.

title: Witching Stick 2010 Fashauer Vineyard Zinfandel (Anderson Valley)
description: This relatively low-alcohol Zinfandel offers dusty blue fruit and piles of earthiness around a core of juicy texture. Straightforward on the finish, with a hit of herb and fresh farm.

title: McManis 2012 Jamie Lynn Vineyard Barbera (California)
description: This is a ridiculously good price for this juicy wine, which offers blackberry and cassis beneath a velvety texture. Enjoy slightly chilled with anything involving tomato sauce. Stock up and make this beauty a house wine.

title: Rack & Riddle NV Sparkling Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)
description: Pretty in orange and pink, this sparkling Rosé is 75% Pinot Noir and 25% Chardonnay, creamy in texture with a pleasing taste of strawberries and cream atop a homemade biscuit. With solid acidity, it'll be both an attractive and effective addition to your springtime brunch or lunch table.

title: Gallica 2011 Suzuri Series Shake Ridge Ranch Red (Amador County)
description: From the estimable Shake Ridge Ranch, winemaker Rosemary Cakebread has fashioned a lovely blend from 53% Grenache, 31% Syrah, 14% Mourvèdre and 2% Viognier. Opening with leathery tannins, the rich and savory concoction imparts juicy dark plum, tobacco and especially coffee.

title: Black Kite 2010 Angel Hawk Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: An amalgamation of the best barrels from the vintage, Angel Hawk brings together Black Kite's three distinct blocks of Pinot into one wine, with the goal of age-worthiness. It succeeds, offering a powerhouse of dark cardamom and clove, walls of structure and complex flavors of savory leather and blueberry, brought together over 20 months in entirely new French oak. Let this beauty rest until 2019–2024 before awakening.

title: Saintsbury 2011 Brown Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a rich, broad-shouldered Pinot Noir, woodsy and oaky with a firm and fierce grip on the palate. It leans more toward earth and smoke than exuberant fruit. Textured in soft undertones of silk, it also offers plenty of fresh herb, a component to take advantage of in pairing.

title: Red Pony Ranch 2012 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: The Red Pony brand is putting out reliably distinct wines. This one smells of cranberry, oregano and barnyard. The tannins and acidity are solid, with strawberry and pomegranate flavors leading to an earthy finish. Hold until 2016 for an even smoother time.

title: Clos du Lac 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)
description: Thirst-quenching, lean and tangy, it would make a good match with shucked oysters. It shows lemon and green apple aromas, plus fresh and crisp citrus flavors. Medium in body, the texture is pleasantly lean while the finish is refreshing.

title: Chamisal Vineyards 2013 Stainless Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Light, bright and refreshing, it offers pear spritzer, lime zest and a hint of guava on the nose, followed by citrus rind, light papaya and apple juice on the palate. It makes a nice bridge between the richness of Chardonnay and crispness of Sauvignon Blanc.

title: Deep Sea 2012 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: A complex nose emerges as this wine opens up with chalk, soda, lemon and lime pith. The scents go well with the ocean breezes at Deep Sea's tasting room on Santa Barbara's wharf. It's lean on the palate, with lime throughout and a bit of papaya on the end.

title: Cuvaison 2012 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This longtime Carneros producer sources from dozens of its own blocks to put together this estate Chardonnay. Intense in floral aromas as well as peach and lemon, it's dusted only slightly in clove and a light barrel imprint. Bright on the tongue and on the finish, it's a food-friendly wine that will complement.

title: Robert Mondavi 2012 Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Inviting in tropical aromas of guava and pineapple, it smells sweet but drinks dry, balanced in melon and high-toned citrus, just a hint of grass on the finish.

title: Still Waters 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Licorice and blackberry scents float off the surface of this estate wine. Once sipped, a thinner juiciness takes hold, with boysenberry and cracked pepper leading the way.

title: Firestone 2012 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Earthy aromas of dried herbs, forest floor and freshly felled fennel shrubs emerge form this blend from the now William Foley-owned Firestone brand. Warm cherries and tart acidity make for a nice blend of fruit and complexity on the palate.

title: Balletto 2013 Teresa's Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: High-toned aromatics precede a light, lean palate, with a jolt of tingling acidity polished around a medium-weight body. There's  a hint of wet stone and spice to the finish.

title: Pull 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry liqueur, violet, cola and slight dustiness form the nose of this well-priced wine. The flavors are a bit thinner than expected, most reminiscent of ripe pomegranate.

title: Broken Earth 2012 Estate Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: There's slight peach, candied lemon, honey and just opened orange-colored rose aromas on the nose. The wine's mouthfeel is very full and even, with pineapple flavors prominent and a slight herbal twist of anise on the finish.

title: Hartley-Ostini 2012 Hitching Post Cork Dancer Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: The Hitching Post team's blend hits the nose with ripe raspberry and wet, black slate scents. It's fairly thin once sipped, mostly tight and tart with pomegranate flavors, though a broader red licorice element adds to the experience.

title: Horse & Plow 2013 Preston Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Made with organically grown grapes, it features a levity of citrus at its heart, a celebration of crisp grapefruit and lime. Dry and midweight, it has texture and a pleasant, long-lasting finish.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2013 Avant Chardonnay (California)
description: This unoaked Chardonnay represents its genera beautifully. It has fresh apple aromas with a hint of honey, just-ripe pear flavors, good acidity and a relaxed texture. Very refreshing, bright and easy to enjoy.

title: Bargetto 2013 Pinot Grigio (Monterey County)
description: This is a great sunny day wine, starting with aromas of honeydew melon, ripe nectarine and lemongrass. There is a slightly peachy, bubblegum character once sipped, with lemon-lime soda in the midpalate and a flinty, gunmetal finish.

title: Decoy 2012 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: Taking time to come around aromatically, it opens up with plum and bright red cherry fruit that follow on the palate, a touch of savory tobacco suggested around the tannins. On the finish expect a balance of spice and sweet as black pepper and caramel compete for affection.

title: Epiphany 2011 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: A complex aromatic profile of the fruit, spice and savory elements found in plum chutney, this promising wine drops off a bit once sipped. But it is still tasty, with freshly picked plum flavors bringing fruit, tartness and tannins together, a bit of bacon fat on the finish.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2011 The Mariner Meritage (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A red Meritage blend of 51% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 10% Cabernet Franc, 5% Petit Verdot and 4% Malbec, the name honors Dry Creek Vineyard's love of seafaring. With a nod to the Old World, it's lean and savory in black tea and exotic herb. Juicy, brambly berry come to the fore on the finish, which is still grippy on the palate.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2013 Estate Grown Viognier (Oak Knoll District)
description: Floral and pretty in ripe peach and pineapple/mango, it unwinds with a finish of vanilla.

title: Wente 2011 Sandstone Merlot (San Francisco Bay-Livermore Valley)
description: Aromatic in black cherry and herb, this is a smooth, round Merlot that'll please many palates, balanced in pleasant fruity tones and vanilla oak.

title: Rock Wren 2009 Syrah (Solano County Green Valley)
description: Dry in meaty tannins, this is a hardbound Syrah, all leather, not so much lace. Grown on a former cherry orchard in Solano County it shows its warm-weather roots, structured in a brawny way with a long, tobacco-like finish.

title: Michael David 2011 Petite Petit Red (Lodi)
description: A blend of 85% Petite Sirah and 15% Petit Verdot, this is a mouthful of intense, smoky blueberry and leather. Licorice and tar intermingle on the midpalate with the finish decisively earthy in graphite.

title: Peltier 2012 Hybrid Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: Crisp with a taste of New Zealand grass, this wine offers pear, lemon and a pinch of fig on the finish amid layers of acidity.

title: Assembly 2012 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Plush and perfumed in smoky leather, this Zin offers more savory flavors and aromas than sweet. A bit of cedar with just the suggestion of crushed blackberry plays most prominently. Given the robust nature of the wine, the finish is surprisingly quick.

title: Peirano 2012 The Heritage Collection Moscato (Lodi)
description: Flowery and sweet through and through, this lighthearted dessert wine could also serve as apéritif as it's perfectly sippable, or as a pairing with something packed with spice, like enchiladas or red curry.

title: LangeTwins 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This Zin, sourced from a blend of old and new vines, has inviting aromas of plum and blackberry that expand into a meaty, smoky, full-figured and slightly sanguine melting pot of flavor. With a soft texture and long finish, it's good value, too.

title: Mad Duck 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This wine offers rich red fruit, oak and smoke around a soft texture and fading finish. A pronounced sweetness hits mid-palate after the smoky oak that makes it seem higher in alcohol than is stated.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2013 Vintner's Reserve Riesling (Monterey County)
description: Mildly sweet and soft-textured, it offers lots of honey and apple flavors. These are backed up by crisp, citrus-like acidity that adds balance and keeps the flavors lively all the way through the finish. It's very tasty and well-rounded.

title: William Hill Estate 2010 Benchmark Red (Napa Valley)
description: Comprised of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot, like the 2011, this vintage of Benchmark is sweeter and rounder, cherry and vanilla most prominent on the palate. Measured acidity helps move things along, the texture generously rich.

title: Sobon Estate 2013 Viognier (Amador County)
description: Dry and full-bodied, this structured version of Viognier has subtle fruit aromas of melon and peach, flavors accented by oak and vanilla, a firm texture and clean finish. A substantial white wine, it should pair well with seafood, light meat dishes and creamy sauces.

title: Souverain 2010 Winemaker's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Earthy and rich in mushroom notes, this wine also has a prominent layer of mocha. It's otherwise juicy in clove and black cherry, the finish a mix of coffee and coconut.

title: Truett Hurst 2013 Salmon Run Rosé Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Meaty, dry and balanced yet big, this is a substantial mouthful of Rosé. Made from Dry Creek Zinfandel with 12% Syrah, it's brooding in dark berry and peach fruit and can be paired much as a full-bodied red wine would be.

title: Naughty Boy 2012 Thornton Ranch Chardonnay (Potter Valley)
description: The sunny personality shows ripe pear, vanilla and melted butter flavors, medium body, a nicely smooth texture and some fresh acidity. The typical California fruitiness seems well complemented by oak.

title: Migration 2012 Searby Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A site planted to the Rued clone of Chardonnay in classic Russian River Valley Goldridge soils, Searby is expressive in honeysuckle and orange blossom floral tones. This balanced wine is soft and round, its time in oak reaching an apex on the finish.

title: Justin 2013 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: A vibrantly tropical nose of guava and ripe pear meets with a touch of hard vanilla candy on this affordably priced wine from the pioneer winery of Paso Robles. It's a powerfully flavorful, cocktail-style Chardonnay, with prominent papaya and mango fruit, followed by a blast of acidity and kiwi grassiness on the finish.

title: Ghost Pines 2012 Winemaker's Blend Red (Napa County-Sonoma County-San Joaquin County)
description: This mélange of grapes from Sonoma (56%), Napa (30%) and San Joaquin County (14%) intermingles Cabernet Sauvignon, Zinfandel, Petite Sirah, Syrah and Petit Verdot. An intense, weighty concoction of strawberry and leather, it's well-priced and distributed widely.

title: Quinta Cruz 2010 Silvaspoons Vineyard Souzao (Alta Mesa)
description: The deep, saturated color and vivid, smoky flavors indicate a monster wine, but the reality is more complex and interesting. It smells like boysenberry, grilled beef and black pepper, tastes grapey and berrylike but also roasted and savory. It is surprisingly light-bodied considering how flavorful it is.

title: Castoro Cellars 2013 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Key lime pie and chalk lead the nose on this affordable offering from a longtime Paso producer. The flavor profile is wide and welcoming, with apple, pear and citrus elements.

title: Cedar View Winery 2011 Madera Syrah (Madera)
description: Full body, plenty of tannin and subdued fruit flavors make this a tight, savory rather than fruity Syrah. It is definitely a food wine, with all the appetizing counterpoints for indulgent steaks, ribs or roasts.

title: Gibbs 2012 Terroir NV Block Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: There is dialed-high acidity on the front palate of this wine, followed by lean layers of pineapple and fig. Aged in 40% new French oak, the toast notes are subtle and the finish satisfyingly soft.

title: Grassini 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: There's a dash of rockiness to the nose of this wine from one of the main producers in this warmer Santa Barbara appellation, but the aromas are mostly ripe pear and red apple. There's not a ton of flair to the light and easy palate, so expect poached pears, a touch of green apple and some grassiness.

title: Michael Pozzan 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Juicy in black and red berry, this relatively inexpensive Cabernet is aged in both French and American oak. Tannins are soft and subtle, the power building on the finish.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2012 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: Aged in a majority of neutral French oak, the wine has opening aromas that impart generous toasty characteristics before mellowing into nutty, vanilla swirls and a lingering taste of green apple.

title: Kenwood 2011 Jack London Vineyard Merlot (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Planks of brawny oak are framed around the blueberry and raspberry fruit brimming in this Merlot, a tribute to Jack London's once-home in nearby Glen Ellen. The herbal component lingers ominously, a refreshing taste of mint popping out on the finish.

title: Broken Earth 2010 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Red clay dust meets boysenberry pie aromas on this wine. The cedar-powered tannins jump on the palate quickly and last long into the finish, with red fruits of strawberry and raspberry gracing the flavor profile.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2008 George's Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Cherry syrup and wet chewing tobacco aromas make for a unique nose. There is good acidity and decent tannic structure, but the dried cherry flavors are quite light for the strong scents.

title: Frog's Leap 2012 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: A lighter style of Zinfandel, with 23% Petite Sirah and 1% Carignane, this is soft in raspberry layers and earthy in pastoral ways. The finish exhibits the Petite's tendency toward tannic muscle.

title: Yates Family Vineyard 2010 Alden Perry Reserve Red (Mount Veeder)
description: Upfront red currant and plum fruit marks this well-composed proprietary blend that offers juicy, leathery texture and plenty of muscle to make an impact. Structured, it could be cellared if need be but is entirely drinkable right now.

title: Brander 2013 Cuvée Natalie White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A very delicate shade of pale yellow, this 50% Sauvignon Blanc, 30% Pinot Gris and 20% Riesling blend offers a refreshing aroma somewhere between passionfruit, pineapple and apple juice. Tart green apple and lime tang emerge once sipped.

title: Brophy Clark 2011 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: The husband-and-wife team behind this label deliver a well-balanced, approachable but serious wine in this bottling. Aromas include red rose, dark violet, pomegranate, limestone and clove. On the palate, there is luscious black cherry fruit, with slate and acidity to stand it up straight.

title: En Garde 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Holding its wines in barrel and bottle longer than most before release, En Garde's Cabernet shows ample, leathery tannin that will benefit from further aging, in addition to being hedonistically enjoyable now. Cinnamon and clove are the most pronounced aromas and flavors, followed by black currant.

title: Apsara 2013 River's Reach Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Fresh and fruity this is a fuller style of Sauvignon Blanc with 10% Sémillon blended in, whole-cluster pressed, and barrel-fermented in neutral oak. It offers tingling acidity and a briny mouthfeel amidst highlights of apricot and savory herb.

title: Adelaida 2011 Viking Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh and vibrant aromas of dark cherry and purple flowers get serious weight from a touch of tar on this very balanced, tighter Cabernet. Dark red fruits, sweet plums (and their more tart skins) and even blueberry show on the palate, which is equally acidic and tannic. It's neither lean nor lush, but right down the middle.

title: Alta Maria 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Aromas recall freshly chopped herbs such as thyme and parsley, with a very likable hint of pine tar as well. That mix of tree resin and Italian herbs comes through on the palate too, making for a flavorful and stand-out wine.

title: Savannah-Chanelle 2010 Muns Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Rugged scents of wild berries and forest woods blend into intriguing aromas on this wine from the highest Pinot Noir vineyard in the Santa Cruz Mountains. It unleashes a rainbow of flavors, from acai and red fruit to rum cake and brown spices to mocha, tea, tobacco and Dr. Pepper.

title: Marimar Estate 2011 Don Miguel Vineyard La Masía Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Estate grown and bottled, this Pinot comes from a cool, organic vineyard planted to several different clones. Sultry and spicy in dark cherry and berry fruit, the spice is all clove with a touch of orange zest, completely pleasurable and smooth drinking.
designation: Don Miguel Vineyard La Masía Unfiltered

title: V. Sattui 2010 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With 4% Petit Verdot added for body and color, this Cab is otherwise on the brighter side of red fruit and acidity, nicely balanced and approachable in cranberry, cassis and a wink of violet. It's not as meaty and robust as the winery's Morisoli, a tamer version of a similar beast.

title: Yates Family Vineyard 2010 Fleur de Veeder Merlot (Mount Veeder)
description: Full-bodied, structured and leathery, it's characterized by a combination of plum and gamy meat, accented by a taste of black olive tapenade. It finishes smooth and toasty.

title: LangeTwins 2010 Centennial Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Lots of fruit character, tannin and oak sensations all blend together in this layered, balanced and yet full-bodied wine. It smells like dark cherries and cinnamon, while flavors suggest ripe raspberries with a dash of maple syrup. Very rich and velvety in texture, it has ample tannin and a lingering finish.

title: Sobon Estate 2012 Old Vines Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: A solid, middleweight Zinfandel, this emphasizes sophisticated, toasty, spicy oak aromas. The oak doesn't overwhelm, however, but enhances the ripe boysenberry flavors, juicy acidity and lingering finish. Enjoyably tannic, this will pair well with grilled lamb, steak and chicken.

title: Presqu'ile 2013 Rosé Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This clean and sleek rosé comes from the Santa Maria Valley-by-way-of-Louisiana Murphy family. Watermelon candy and juice on the nose come with a touch of peach. These are followed by nice tension on the palate between strawberry fruit, bright acidity, chalk minerality, and quite a noticeable tannic grip for a pink wine.

title: Quadrant 2010 Copper Red (Paso Robles)
description: Spiced plums and purple flowers such as violet make for an appealing aromatic profile on this well-priced wine, a blend of 57% Syrah, 23% Petite Sirah, 17% Grenache and 3% Viognier. The palate is soft with flavors of ginger and red currant, tasting elegant though not exactly restrained. The strong tannins could use until 2016 to mellow out properly.

title: St. Supéry 2012 Virtú Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Virtú is the winery's white blend, this vintage partnering 56% Sémillon with 44% Sauvignon Blanc. The combination is explosive, briny and flowery in the best ways, a taste of apple and fresh-squeezed lime vibrant on the palate, followed by savory herb and a nuanced taste of toasty oak. The aroma conveys a sense of fresh salt air.

title: Longoria 2012 Fe Ciega Vineyard Block M Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A lesson in elegant restraint, it offers a subtle nose of eucalyptus, rhubarb and roasted root vegetables, followed by reticently emergent flavors of cherry, blackberry and wet dirt. Extremely delicate with vibrant acidity, this wine only comes out of its shell when paired with a good meal.

title: MacMurray Ranch 2012 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Generous in spicy clove and dark cherry fruit, a mark of its Middle Reach Russian River Valley clime, this wine is full of life and minerality. It offers good value for Russian River Valley, and the finish boasts a zesty pepper accent.

title: Lusso Della Terra 2013 Rose of Merlot (California)
description: Brilliant pink with a touch of orange, this refreshing and light-bodied wine tastes fresh and strawberrylike. It has an appetizingly crisp texture and clean fruity finish.

title: MacLaren 2013 Lee's Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Winemaker Steve Law, a specialist in cool-climate Syrah, offers a barrel-fermented and barrel-aged Sauv Blanc named for his mom. It's completely herbal, dry, savory and complex, yet deliciously sippable.

title: St. Francis 2011 Rockpile Red (Sonoma County)
description: From a base of 51% Cabernet Sauvignon this robust red adds Petit Verdot, Merlot and Malbec to concoct a soft, smooth and juicy red wine that's brooding in personality. The tannins are tar-like and sizable.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2011 Artemis Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A majority Cabernet Sauvignon with 14% Merlot blended in, Artemis is aromatically inviting in dark plum, currant and a streak of herb. Light, lean and well-balanced, the wine features soft, barely perceptible tannins. Tri-tip is a wise pairing suggestion.

title: Star Lane Vineyard 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Extremely sharp scents of freshly cut grass morph into tart Granny Smith apple and hints of guava on this bottling from one of the most striking vineyards in California. It's bright and lively on the palate, proving easy-to-drink, uncomplicated and fresh.

title: Rodney Strong 2013 Charlotte's Home Sauvignon Blanc (Northern Sonoma)
description: A stunning squeeze of fresh tangerine enlivens both the aroma and palate of this crisp wine that's high in acidity and dancing in refreshing tangents of lemongrass, kiwi and pineapple. Enjoy poolside or on a patio.

title: Summerland 2013 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Quite light in color, this is a lighter style of Chardonnay, kicking off with crispy green apple aromas mixed with a bit of barrel smoke. Lime and apple lead the lean palate, which shines with granite minerality.

title: Summerland 2013 Happy Canyon Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)
description: Widely accessible and hedonistic aromas of cherry pie with a tinge of wild mint lead the nose on this young but ready county blend. The palate is framed with oak influence and the associated tannins, as well as plum and ripe cherry fruit. It's unusual that this 2013 is on the market after 10 months in barrel.

title: Longevity 2013 Pinot Blanc (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine is substantial enough for rich fish dishes and other entrees. It smells and tastes like almonds and apricots and has a nicely viscous texture. Full-bodied, it is complex, sophisticated, dry and has a lingering finish.

title: Joullian 2012 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Grapefruit pith, green apple and sea salt make for a striking nose from fruit grown on one of the appellation's older vineyards. Rich flavors of apple cream, lemon curd and salty caramel carry the palate.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2012 Vintners Reserve Summation Red (California)
description: This serious red blend puts together a texture firmed up with gripping tannins and acidity, flavors brimming with blackberry and sweet spices and a lingering finish. Too structured to appreciate alone, it will need pairing with roast beef, lasagna, ribs or the like.

title: Arrowood 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Lemony and toasty, this approachable wine is rich and balanced, its texture soft and the flavors long-lasting, highlighted by a taste of lemon meringue.

title: Calavera 2012 Dalton Vineyard Grenache (Calaveras County)
description: Good, solid fruit flavors fill out this light-colored but full-bodied Grenache. It has ripe plum, tart cherry and cedar nuances; a broad, firm texture helps flavors linger on the finish. It's the kind of wine that tastes better with each sip.

title: Caliza 2012 Kissin' Cousins White (Paso Robles)
description: Peach, honeyed limes and apple sauce aromas lead the nose of this blend made with 62% Viognier, 26% Grenache Blanc and 12% Rousanne. Caliza's Carl Bowker demonstrates great restraint in these often bombastic white Rhônes, so the apple-led palate is subdued, showing bits of spice or a touch of mustard on the end.

title: Virage 2013 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: A direct-pressed rosé, cotton-candy pink in color, this wine is dry, light and under 13% alcohol. It offers touches of grass and herby minerality, faint swirls of white peach playful on the tongue. Served chilled, this makes for a delightful apéritif to go with oysters on the half shell.

title: VML 2012 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Lemon-lime and lemon curd mark this wine. The lemon theme continues throughout the layers of apple, vanilla and oak, the oak not perceptible until near the round, voluptuous finish.

title: Hunnicutt 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: The winery makes a line of Cabernet Sauvignon from various AVAs of the Napa Valley, highlighting each on the label. From warmer Calistoga, this mouthCab is brambly black fruit-forward with layers of coffee and mocha.

title: Ideology 2012 Blondie Gone Wild Red Hen Vineyard Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: Light in oak and mid-weight all in all, this Chardonnay from a cooler sub-section of the Napa Valley is replete with baked apple veering into dried fruit character and a touch of vanilla.
designation: Blondie Gone Wild Red Hen Vineyard

title: Kokomo 2013 Pauline's Vineyard Rosé Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Grenache's essential fruity character is well-preserved thanks to the use of a whole berry press. Popcorn pink in color, it offers sweetly peachy flavors adorned by wild strawberry and tangerine. The wine light and minerally.

title: Bonneau 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: A 100% Cabernet Sauvignon that offers cherry, plum and earthy spice, the tannins soft and supple. This is a wine to enjoy now, aged close to two years in French oak, 20% of it new.

title: Brander 2011 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: The first to plant the grape in the Santa Ynez Valley, Fred Brander has a current Cab Franc release that hits the nose with black-as-night scents of wet potting soil and black pepper. The flavors are slow to emerge, but blueberry crumble, chocolate and crushed herbs appear with patience.

title: Broken Earth 2010 Reserve Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)
description: Candied blackberry, creosote and hot tar aromas fuel the nose of this Petit Verdot, a grape increasingly getting solo time in Central Coast bottles. It's thick on the palate, with smoked tobacco, peppery spice and cigar-like tannins.

title: Left Bend 2011 Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a potpourri of wildly distinct and amazing aromas on this 60% Syrah-40% Cabernet Sauvignon, from cooked ripe cranberries and distinct black pepper to red clay, anise, violet and savory goulash with dried strawberries. Raspberry, pepper and cola overtake the palate, with a refreshing tartness on the finish.

title: Broman 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This late-release has benefited from its time in bottle. Juicy and beguiling in red raspberry and black cherry fruit, it has a back layering of spicy cardamom and a sphere of acidity. Buoyant and memorable, it finishes with more spice and savory leather.

title: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2010 Terzetto Red (Napa Valley)
description: This elegant Terzetto is equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot from the Chiles Valley District on the far eastern side of Napa Valley. The grapes are grown organically by the Eisele family, who have farmed these parts for 40 years. Dusty red fruit entice from the beginning, unveiling a soft, round and drinkable wine with the structure to age until 2024–2029.

title: Garnet 2012 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Bacon fat and cream soda meet with a flash of patchouli on the nose of this stunning deal from winemaker/author/blogger Alison Crowe. Cherry cola flavors and luscious red fruits get lifted with smoke and plum-skin bitterness, all set against decent tannins and fresh acidity.

title: Walt 2012 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an elegant, heady Chardonnay beaming in floral jasmine aromas, honey and oak. Bright on the palate, it offers lively acidity and an abundance of pineapple and mango, tropical in all the right ways.

title: Pride Mountain 2012 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Aged in 25% new French oak, the rest of it neutral, this age-worthy Chardonnay shows refreshing restraint, though it retains plenty of fruit. The aromas tend toward faint caramel and a complex web of acidity and brightness accompanies notes of apple and pear, a long finish capping things off.

title: Bogle 2012 Essential Red (California)
description: This dry red blend is as sophisticated, structured and balanced as many high-end Cabernets. Made from old-vine Zin, with Syrah, Cabernet and Petite Sirah as well, it has a deep, exotic aroma of dark fruit plus cedar and cardamom. The flavor is richly fruity, the mouthfeel is firmly textured and the finish lingers nicely. It's medium bodied and full-flavored.

title: Cliff Lede 2011 Moondance Dream Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: The winery's Poetry Vineyard names its blocks for famous rock songs, this one a combination of Van Morrison's “Moondance” and Aerosmith's “Dream On.” The resulting wine, mostly Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller portions of Petit Verdot, Malbec and Merlot, is elegant in earthy cinnamon and clove followed by currant and black cherry, with a spiciness to the taste. The finish all savory, smoky oak.

title: Esser 2012 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: This fresh-smelling wine blends aromas of caramel apple and light grapefruit juice. The palate is racy in acidity, like a glass of fresh orange juice splashed with squeezes of lemon and grapefruit, and a vanilla warmth toward the finish.

title: Joullian 2012 RogerRose Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: The aromas from this Dijon clone-planted vineyard start with sweet ripe peach until a touch of flint and sage emerge. The plush, creamy palate leans toward tropicality, also with peach and lime, plus a slight mustard bitterness.

title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2011 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Movie theater aromas of caramel candy, buttered popcorn and burned popcorn kernels converge on the nose of this classic Chardonnay from one of California's most historic vineyards. Despite the prominent nose, the flavors are elegantly restrained, with a brisk acidity surrounding warmer notes of caramelized pineapple.

title: Shafer 2011 One Point Five Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: A substantial and imminently structured wine from a coolish vintage, this blends 92% Cabernet Sauvignon with 5% Petit Verdot and 3% Malbec to impressive effect. Leathery and intense it will benefit with time, its black pepper, red cassis fruit and flowery anise layers commingling in complex ways.

title: Rocca 2010 Vespera Red (Napa Valley)
description: Vespera combines Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Merlot and Petite Sirah from two of the winery's signature vineyards, Grigsby and Collinetta, into an explosion of chocolate, mint and intense tannins. A tropical layer lurks on the back palate, making the wine an intriguing quaff.

title: Rodney Strong 2011 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Lengthy and expansive, this wine offers cherry and herb on the nose, followed by a taste of chocolate and anise, with a jolt of spicy black pepper on the finish. Ready to drink now it's also structured enough to age 2017–2019.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2012 Vintner's Reserve Zinfandel (Mendocino)
description: Delicious, almost sweet fruit flavors are wrapped in firm, velvety tannins for a seriously enjoyable experience. There's a feeling of polish in the texture, and careful balance between full body, good tannin structure and lively acidity.

title: Rosa d'Oro 2012 Barbera (Clear Lake)
description: This has a vivid, ripe, black cherry flavor, with fresh sweetness and bursting acidity. It makes for a gorgeous, generous character buoyed up by firm tannins, a lively texture and finish, and no noticeable oak. A great find from a small, ambitious Lake County winery that loves Italian varietals.

title: The Messenger NV Telegram Red Wine Number One Lot 612 Red (California)
description: A dramatic, full-flavored and full-bodied red from a small, adventurous Napa-based winery. It offers cedar and tobacco aromas, fresh dark cherry flavors, and good depth and concentration. Strong and generous, this wine is looking to have a good time with you at the dinner table. The blend includes 58% Cabernet Sauvignon, plus Merlot, Montepulciano, Malbec and Cabernet Franc.
designation: Telegram Red Wine Number One Lot 612

title: Hovey 2012 Walker Cuvée Barbera (El Dorado)
description: Richness and depth are the hallmarks of this full-flavored, complex and complete wine. Attractive cinnamon and toasted bread aromas blend into ripe cherry flavors. The texture is smooth, the tannins moderate and the finish long. It deserves the best osso buco or risotto Piemontese.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2011 Old Vine Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
description: Fruity and juicy in blackberry and black cherry, this mountain-grown Zin has soft, integrated tannins and a backbone of spiciness, white pepper mostly, and dark black licorice, that winds its way through the finish.

title: Fess Parker 2012 Rodney's Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)
description: Sharp melons, yellow flowers, banana candy, toasty oak and honey converge for a very pleasing and inviting nose on this wine from an estate vineyard. The palate is even and lively, with citrus rind, lemon curd and peach flavors, finishing with an appealing sense of smokiness.

title: Justin 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: The reserved nose offers chalk, nectarine and apple cider. It remains lean once sipped, with crushed white rock minerality and a bit of nice creaminess.

title: Michael Pozzan 2011 Annabella Platinum Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: There's a marked note of menthol in this wine followed by thin layers of earthy loam and savory red fruit.

title: San Simeon 2010 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Completely opaque in the glass, the strong nose blends brandy, cherry syrup and coffee. It's a bit tannic once sipped, with flavors of blueberry soda and prune.

title: Fritz 2010 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: An element of camphor and menthol surrounds soft, structured tannins and minimal fruit.

title: Morse 2009 Three Popes Red (Amador County)
description: A strong earthy aroma and flavor dominate this medium-bodied red, muffling the fruit character and keeping it rather one-dimensional. The texture is on the soft side. 55% Grenache, 29% Mourvèdre, 16% Syrah.

title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2013 Chardonnay (California)
description: This tastes like a good weekday wine or an affordable purchase for a big party. A nice core of fruit flavor is complemented by subtle hints of bread dough and vanilla, soft texture and medium body.

title: CK Mondavi 2012 Wildcreek Canyon Merlot (California)
description: This smells and tastes fruity and lean, almost like straight grape juice. It could serve well as a lunch wine or at an outdoor concert wine. Light to medium-bodied, it's also light in texture and cherrylike in flavor.

title: Naggiar 2010 Estate Grown Barbera (Sierra Foothills)
description: Two profiles emerge in this deep-colored, ripe-tasting and very dry Barbera. It smells and, at first, tastes almost overripe and pruny, with a soft, broad texture. Then the firm acidity and slightly tough tannins kick in on the finish. Not an ideal balance, but it will be good with especially rich dishes.

title: Oak Grove 2012 Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Agreeable and smooth, this tastes pro-actively flavored with oak. The wood character comes out as flavors of maple syrup, vanilla and clove in addition to the plum and raspberry notes from the grapes. It's good, commercial-quality red wine.

title: Matchbook 2011 Syrah (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This begins with earthy, meaty, slightly smoky aromas. Moderate plum and pepper flavors convey a savory character rather than a fruity one, and the wine has a smooth texture. It starts out interesting and complex, and then closes down on the palate and finish.

title: Quinta Cruz 2013 Silvaspoons Vineyard Verdelho (Alta Mesa)
description: A grassy white, this combines fresh herb and celery aromas with a heavy, oily texture and lingering, veggie notes on the finish. It's interesting to explore this Portuguese varietal that's unusual in California.

title: Klinker Brick 2013 Rosé (Lodi)
description: A dry rosé that has a light pink color, earthy but candy-like aromas, and lean peach and apple flavors. Good, but somewhat funky.

title: Campus Oaks 2012 Old Vine Merlot (Mendocino)
description: Quite tannic, this has smoky, peppery aromas and dark fruit flavors. Deep and dark in color, it's medium-bodied and firm and dry in texture.

title: Insomnia 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This has a light color for a Cabernet Sauvignon, light herb and raspberry aromas, too, but with a full pruney flavor and fading finish. Medium-bodied and smooth-textured, it's not at all tannic and fairly soft in balance.

title: IL Gioiello 2011 Barbera (Amador County)
description: This has an old-school, old-world earthiness that won't appeal to everyone, but some people will love. It smells like wet earth and barnyard, tastes like raspberries, feels medium bodied and smooth textured.

title: Paul Hobbs 2012 Hyde Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Mouthwateringly juicy in bright tart cherry fruit, this is lush, with delicate acidity and completely resolved tannins. It provides a masterful study in how to balance an exuberance of ripe California fruit while still offering finesse and restraint.

title: Lazy Creek 2012 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Full-bodied and generously flavorful, this is shaped and accented by oak influences, but still governed by rich, enticing flavors of ripe plum, dark cherry, blackberry and cinnamon. It features great depth of flavor, breadth in the silky texture and length on the finish. Best now through 2020.

title: Paul Hobbs 2012 Richard Dinner Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)
description: This exquisitely crafted model of balance offers lemon-bar meringue and baked pear on the nose before revealing a tightrope of minerality and lush concentration on the palate, weighted perfectly against each other. Fleshy and delicious, the wine has so much fine fruit to offer now it'd be shame to wait, yet it will clearly hold onto its beauty with age.

title: Paul Hobbs 2012 Ellen Lane Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Sunflower-gold in color, this heady, hedonistic Chardonnay brims with aromas of toasted brioche, lemon and herb. Bright and completely balanced, it invites sip after sip until there simply is no more. Concentrated and complex it finishes dry, lingering in beautiful layers on the tongue.

title: Justin 2010 Isosceles Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Justin's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon—which this vintage features 5% Malbec, 3% Cabernet Franc and 2% Merlot—drinks like a compelling mystery novel with many twists and turns. It opens with scents of red clay and black earth, then leads into deliciously rich but uplifting flavors of olallieberry reduction sauce with some mocha and mincemeat pie.

title: Laurel Glen 2012 Counterpoint Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Mountain)
description: This is the winery's more accessible and approachable Cabernet, ready to drink. Robust flavors of tobacco and brambly blackberry provide a nod to the mountain provenance. The wine spent more than a year in oak, 30% of it new French and 10% of it new American. The wood flavor is pronounced, a taste of vanilla an endpoint to the finish.

title: Tuck Beckstoffer 2013 Est. 1975 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: White pepper and celery aromas, along with distinctly herbaceous and tart flavors give a tight aspect. It is definitely light, crisp and mouth-cleansing; would be great with raw oysters or goat cheese on toasts.

title: HandCraft 2012 Inspiration A Red Wine Red (California)
description: Fresh raspberry and blackberry flavors liven up this juicy wine. A strong note of sweet maple syrup comes out in the aroma and the flavors. It feels soft in texture and medium-bodied, but a sheen of tannin makes the finish dry.

title: Ancient Oak Cellars 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Blackberry is the flavor frontrunner in this soft, supple Cabernet. It's medium-bodied and toned-down in tannins. Drink now.

title: Bishop's Peak 2013 Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo)
description: Talley Vineyards' bargain brand offers light lemon and chalk aromas before delivering a palate where brisk acidity is the primary player. White rocks, apple, lime and honeysuckle flavors linger in the wings.

title: William Hill Estate 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: Well-rounded, this offers aromas of fresh-cut grass and citrus fruit, citrusy flavors, good acidity, a smooth texture and soft finish. Very refreshing, it will be a good match with seafood, goat cheese or grilled chicken.

title: La Chertosa 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: From Sam Sebastiani comes this Chardonnay made in a classic California manner. Rich in buttery oak and sweet vanilla, the grapes are a mix of Wente and older clones, fermented and aged in a combination of French oak, a third of it new.

title: Bink 2013 Old Chatham Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Yorkville Highlands)
description: This has a restrained but earthy personality that grows on you as you sip. It smells faintly like a pine forest, tastes like grapefruit and stays nicely tangy on the finish. It should loosen up and taste even better by mid-2015.

title: Core Winery 2009 Hard Core Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Yet another extreme barrel-aged wine from Core Wine Co. Cherry syrup and heavy wood presence on the nose is followed by dark chocolate, cooked vanilla and other flavors dominated by wood and age.

title: Entwine 2012 Chardonnay (California)
description: Subtle flavors and a rather lush texture make this medium-bodied Chardonnay very pleasant to taste. The aromas are like melon and apple, the flavors are modestly fruity and minerally, and the finish is clean. It was produced by the Food Network and Wente Vineyards.

title: Field Stone 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)
description: Dry and refreshing this is a crisp white from a warm region of Sonoma County. A hit of sweetness to the finish is a mere accent, the way adding vanilla to pancake batter can be. The fruitiness comes from lemon, melon and grapefruit rind.

title: Presqu'ile 2012 Presqu'ile Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Coming from one of the appellation's newest and most exciting vineyards, this oak-powered wine opens with notes of bright citrus and vanilla-laced buttercream. The palate is powered by the barrel, with hardcore caramel and an almost bitter tannic element. Better for the oak lovers than the acid heads.

title: Three Sticks 2012 One Sky Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)
description: From a vineyard on the southeastern side of Sonoma Mountain this spent more than a year in French oak, half of it new. Golden in color, it features quiet aromatics of coconut and tropical pineapple around light minerality and a citrus-tinged finish.

title: McFadden 2013 Blue Quail Chardonnay (Potter Valley)
description: Fresh and apparently unoaked, this offers an appealing floral aroma, with a slight buttery accent over the crisp apple flavors. It is light to medium-bodied, soft in texture, showing no apparent oak flavors but instead straightforward fruit character.

title: Circadia 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This has the herbaceous character that is true to its varietal type. A bit more zip (acidity) would complement the strong flavors. It shows grassy, snap-pea aromas, canteloupe notes and a soft texture.

title: Ironstone 2013 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Light and charming, this offers floral aromas, tropical fruit flavors, perhaps a touch of sweetness, a smooth texture, medium body and appley finish. It should be refreshing when well chilled.

title: J. Rickards 2013 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)
description: Grass and gooseberry compete for favor in this zesty, straightforward wine. It's long on the finish in tropical hits of pineapple and guava.

title: Mirassou 2013 Riesling (California)
description: Exuberant fruit flavors animate this semisweet, easy-to-like Riesling. The texture is smooth, the flavors are like ripe peach and pineapple and the body is rather light. It's sweet enough to go well with dessert.

title: Naggiar 2011 Estate Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: With moderate fruit flavors, nicely dry tannins and firm acidity, this offers a big structure that pairs well with rich meat and cheese dishes.

title: Summerwood 2013 Grenache Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: A wonderful nose of white flowers, pear cider, honeydew, guava soda and papaya promises an interesting wine. Then bitterness takes hold of the palate, which is tense the entire time with lime and grapefruit pith dominating a little apple fruit. Very fresh, but challenging. Serve with spicy foods.

title: Mercy 2012 Zabala Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: There's warm brioche and pluot skin aromas to this tightly wound wine from a particularly river rock-strewn vineyard. The palate is pungently acidic with bitter lime peel surrounding a cooked apple core. Serve with raw shellfish as a replacement for squeezed citrus.

title: Sextant 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe, juicy berries dominate the nose, getting some aromatic lift from hints of eucalyptus and menthol. The mint and red fruit of cherries consume the straight-forward palate, which is more bright and lean than rich and tannic.

title: Taplin Cellars 2009 Terra 9 Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Soft in black fruit, licorice and a chocolatey richness, offset by dusty tannins, this Cabernet is also accented by subtle spice and ripe plum.

title: Black Box 2013 Platinum Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: A strong showing for wine that comes in a box, this begins with aromas of nectarine and peach before delivering stone fruit flavors on the palate as well. A touch of bitter tension on the end makes for a solid value wine, great for camping and parties.

title: Core Winery 2009 MGS Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Burnt caramel and cherry brandy aromas present a very aged profile on the nose. The flavors and tannins are quite heavy as well, thick in the mouth, yet the acidity is quite bright for being five years old amidst such overpowering elements.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2013 Vintner's Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Layers of flavor and a buttery note characterize this medium-bodied Sauvignon. It falls between the crisp New Zealand style and the oak-aged Fumé Blanc style, with good aspects of both. The finish turns slightly sweet.

title: X 2012 Big Gun Red (California)
description: This dark-colored, richly textured and full-bodied wine offers an apparent touch of sweetness and lots of spicy oak overtones. It does have tannins, and they form a fine texture rather than drying out the mouth. Blended from Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Merlot and Grenache.

title: Olema 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Red currant and clove mark this wine that's lean in yeasty bread tones, with soft tannins.

title: Taj 2008 Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: Fresh blackberry bramble flirts with the aromas and flavors of a baked cobbler. The acidity is high-toned and vibrant through the midpalate, before dropping off a touch on the finish.

title: Reflections 2010 Meritage (Alexander Valley)
