description: Made from 79% Cabernet Sauvignon and 21% Merlot, this was aged in French oak, all new, for almost two years. This is a leathery and savory wine, the tannins soft and firm and the nose perfumed in wild cassis and coconut. On the finish is a sensation of burnt cedar.

title: Vino Vargas 2012 Toro Tinto Tempranillo (Clements Hills)
description: A cocoa-like aroma, rich mouthfeel and velvety tannins add up to a fun taste experience with this medium-bodied Tempranillo from a sub-district of Lodi. The flavors are plummy, chocolaty, oaky and spicy.

title: Press Cellars 2010 Elsburg Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Black in color, this is medium weight with the substantial tannins characteristic of Howell Mountain fruit. It ventures into very ripe flavors of dark plum and savory tobacco and oak.

title: Migration 2012 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Fruity and robust in apple and tropical citrus, this is well-defined and balanced in terms of oak and richness, the aromatics a tad muted. Fermentation occurred in both stainless steel and French oak.

title: Eight Sides 2012 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Cherry juice, wet clay, nutmeg and chamise make for an intriguing nose on this well-priced Zinfandel. The easy-drinking palate leans toward fruit punch, making for good summer drinking at a barbecue or the beach.

title: Wines Gone Wild 2012 Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: This soft Zinfandel offers fruity blackberry notes and pings of cinnamon spice, making it an easygoing wine that's ripe and round. The colorful label carries original artwork of one of the winery owners.

title: Noceto 2011 Sangiovese (Amador County)
description: Dry, restrained and a bit mouthpuckering with tannins and acidity, this needs to pair with antipasti like Italian salumi. Its lean texture and tart cherry and cranberry flavors do make it appetizing and help it stand out from the crowd of simply ripe California reds.

title: Chloe 2012 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Made by winemaker Georgetta Dane, this white is awash in kumquat and vanilla, the medium-bodied layers of texture soft and round and accessible to a broad range of palates.

title: Guarachi Family 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% Cabernet Sauvignon that spent a year and a half in French oak, more than half of it new, this is a big-boned wine, leathery and full. An undeniable earthiness lurks in the background.

title: Taj 2008 Syrah (Los Carneros)
description: Medium-bodied, spicy and peppery, this offers dark plum and earthy leather, the fruit tasting quite ripe.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)
description: Made closer to a New Zealand style, freshly cut grass never far behind, this white also exhibits plenty of California tropical fruit and an intensity of acidity, particularly as it finishes.

title: Rack & Riddle NV Sparkling Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)
description: Pretty in orange and pink, this sparkling Rosé is 75% Pinot Noir and 25% Chardonnay, creamy in texture with a pleasing taste of strawberries and cream atop a homemade biscuit. With solid acidity, it'll be both an attractive and effective addition to your springtime brunch or lunch table.

title: Langtry 2008 Serpentine Meadow Vineyard Petite Sirah (Guenoc Valley)
description: Aged for two-and-a-half years in American oak, this Petite Sirah shows off the variety's preference for aging, a study in dense, rounded tannins and juicy red and blue fruit. With savory hints of cedar wood and leather, it'll appeal to Petite fans and accompany roasts and grilled meats well.

title: Eclectic 2011 Tempranillo (Sierra Foothills)
description: Soft and round with a tannic bite, this is a substantial Tempranillo, bright in black cherries and strawberries with a core of leathery tobacco mid-palate and a taste of vanilla on the finish.

title: Urban Legend 2011 Holland Landing Vineyard Tempranillo (Clarksburg)
description: A mouth-filling red that's dry and chewy in tannins, with a dark berry core surrounded by roasted herbs and earth. Lush on the palate it's in balance and well-made, from a relatively cool growing region near the Sacramento Delta.

title: Parducci 2012 Small Lot Blend Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: With aromas of candied apple and a crisp, dry, soft texture, this is a well made, easy-to-like wine that's accessible, integrated with classic Chardonnay flavors.

title: Rack & Riddle NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)
description: A Blanc de Noirs made entirely from Pinot Noir this is an eagerly effervescent wine, salmon in color, with a flavor of raspberry liqueur that's otherwise crisp and high in acidity. With a long finish, it'll match a range of Pinot Noir-friendly foods, especially at brunch: think Quiche Lorraine.

title: Truchard 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Carneros)
description: Aromas of menthol and toasty oak come to the fore first in this lean wine, followed by black cherry and a nutty characteristic that's hard to pin down. The soft tannins are accented by a spicy finish and a hint of vanilla, too.

title: Still Waters 2010 Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Grape soda, prune, leather, graphite, dust and black tobacco blend into an intriguing nose on this estate Malbec from Paso's Eastside. It's a little rustic around the edges once sipped, but pleasantly so. The mouthfeel is soft, the flavors are peppery and the tannins and acidity are built to last.

title: Stomping Ground 2010 Merlot (California)
description: Nothing is out of place in this solid, attractive and well-priced Merlot. It is a straightforward red wine that feels well-balanced, is medium to full-bodied, and has tasty, mellow plum and cherry flavors. Firm tannins mark the clean finish.

title: Leaping Horse 2013 Chardonnay (California)
description: This does a good job of balancing lively pear and apple flavors with dashes of toast and butter. It's medium to full-bodied, dry and has enough crispness to help the flavors linger.

title: Dante Robere 2012 Dante's Inferno Red (California)
description: A boisterous, easy-drinking red wine that gushes ripe fruit and sweet oak aromas. It tastes almost sweet, like blackberry jam, and seems soft-textured in spite of its full body.

title: Dealy Lane 2012 Unoaked Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: This unoaked Chardonnay is awash in green apple, tart lemon and tropical pineapple, light and lifted on the palate. It goes down easily, and will track well at the table. Salads, seafood and brunch-type fare are all good bets.

title: Refugio Ranch 2011 Tiradora Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Sharp, pungent grass scents and a bit of rough citrus form the nose. Once sipped, thin and brisk apple cider flavors get help from slight kiwi and fresh acidity. Serve with bay scallop salad.

title: Oak Grove 2012 Family Reserve Zinfandel (California)
description: Here is a tasty, light-bodied Zin with its own style and a great price. It has a minty, eucalyptus aroma and vivid raspberry flavors, almost sweet in balance. Medium-bodied, it delivers a lingering fruity finish.

title: Epiphany 2012 Camp Four Vinyard Grenache Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: There are distinct and pleasant aromas of chalk and pear on the nose of this Grenache Blanc, one of the many Rhône-style wines made by this winery run by the family of the late actor-turned-vintner Fess Parker. It's a very straightforward sipper, not hugely complex, but refreshing and bright with slight nectarine flavors and lush pear.

title: Bliss 2013 Estate Bottled Rosé (Mendocino)
description: A showy, exuberant wine, from the hot pink color to the fresh, jammy aromas to the just-sweet finish. However, it feels soft in texture and body, with mild cherry-candy and peach flavors.

title: Esser 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: This offers fruit cocktail aromas, with canned pears and light honey, making for an inviting if not varietally typical nose. The flavors are light once sipped, closest to nectarine and apricot. This would be a very drinkable lunchtime wine.

title: Cinnabar 2011 Tripartite Red (California)
description: A lighter style of red blend, this is easy to drink and enjoy. It doesn't have a strong personality but is well-balanced, fruity and juicy, mild and smooth. It shows a light texture, moderately ripe cherry flavors and medium body.

title: Domino 2013 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This perennial Best Buy is one of the richer, more expressive styles of Pinot Grigio. It combines a ripe pear aroma and tangy apple flavors in a smooth texture that stays crisp enough to linger on the finish.

title: Douglas Green 2013 The Beachhouse Chardonnay (California)
description: Fresh and tangy, with little or no oak influence, this refreshing, crisp white wine will be very versatile with or without food. It has citrus aromas, green apple flavors and a nicely tart finish.

title: Twenty Bench 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: There's a world of lemon chiffon and vanilla crème brûlée in this wine, both aromatically and in taste. Medium weight and well-balanced, it delivers a hit of tart lemon on the finish.

title: Belle Ambiance 2012 Red (California)
description: A well-built red, this features a tasty core of plum and raspberry flavors surrounded by appealing, slightly sweet oak accents that come out as vanilla and cinnamon. Perhaps it's not tight or tannic enough for everyone, but it should be a crowd pleaser.

title: Judson Hale Winery 2012 Walsh Ranch Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)
description: The color goes from medium garnet in the middle to a light brownish on the rim. It smells like dried cherry, sage and toast, and tastes substantially fruity. The wine feels just structured enough by acidity and tannin for balance.

title: Groth 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Soft layers of blackberry, cedar and tannin are offered in this lean, lush red. The winery owner says it pairs well with steak, or as he puts it, “A slab and a Cab.”

title: Esser 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey County)
description: This affordable bottling from sustainably minded vineyards is a good everyday dinner wine. It offers violet and blackberry on the nose and a lush feel in the mouth, with black cherry and soft tannins.

title: Noceto 2010 OGP Original Grandpere Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied and apparently sweet Zinfandel drinks more like a Port than a dry wine. It smells like boysenberry syrup on waffles, has a juicy, soft texture, and raisin and prune flavors.

title: Villa San Juliette 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Passionfruit dominates the nose on winemaker Matt Ortman's tropically infused take on the grape, with a dash of kiwi to lighten things up. That tropicality rules the palate as well, but with a touch of flint as a grounding element.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2007 Test Pilot Sabre Jet F-86 Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Elegant aromas suggest tar, prune, cherry preserves and mint. It's soft on the mouth with unfolding tannins, featuring flavors of Italian herbs and cedar. It's a very austere and extremely dry wine, with very little overt fruit.

title: Michael David 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A zesty, citric crispness balances with a soothing element of soft apple character. Fermented in stainless steel, it has a smooth texture and ripe fruit flavors. Balanced and approachable; drink now.

title: Pull 2010 CdR Red (Paso Robles)
description: Pull's well-priced portfolio delivers consistent quality, and this 54% Syrah, 27% Petite Sirah, 16% Grenache, and 3% Viognier blend is appealing, with black cherry aromas lingering amidst rose petals and mint. Blackberry juice wins the palate, with a touch of black licorice and ample yet easygoing tannins.

title: Haka by Labyrinth 2010 Freebird Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of Merlot and Tempranillo, with touches of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon, opens with notes of warm cherry pie, black tobacco and cedar. Fresh boysenberry starts the palate, with mouthwatering spice in the midpalate and mocha on the finish.

title: Krutz 2010 Stagecoach Vineyard Limited Edition Artist Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A Syrah-esque bit of smoke and cured meat wafts from this wine aromatically, which follows through on the palate. Bright cherry and currant fruit then intermix with a restrained sense of clove spice, the Stagecoach Cab blended with Malbec and Petit Verdot, aged in 60% new French oak.
designation: Stagecoach Vineyard Limited Edition Artist Series

title: Naggiar 2010 Don Giovanni Estate Grown Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This bold, dry, firmly tannic wine will taste good now with rich foods, but could easily improve with aging through 2017. It is deeply colored, full bodied and a bit sandy in texture, yet that grip seems O.K. in this wine, balanced by the ripe fruit flavors.

title: Brander 2012 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Cigar box and very ripe strawberry dominate the aromatic profile, though a bit of bell pepper lingers in the background. It's light and racy on the palate, with cherry cola, cedar and mellow tannins, making for a very fresh and fun wine, best served after mild chilling.

title: Broken Earth 2010 CV Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe strawberry pie and cigar box aromas frame the nose on this top-end offering from Broken Earth. It's surprisingly light on the palate, with cherry pie and cranberry tartness leading the way alongside bright acidity and dainty tannins.

title: Wise Villa 2012 Estate Grown and Produced Touriga Nacional (Sierra Foothills)
description: This well-balanced red made from a variety used in Port wines grows on you with each sip. It has bright cherry and raspberry aromas, exotic floral flavors, good acidity, a smooth texture and medium body. It should be versatile with food.

title: Davis Bynum 2012 River West Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A sizable barrel imprint shows aromatically, the gist of which is caramel and toffee. Those aromas are followed by softly textured, intense flavors of baked apple and crème brûlée. The well-made finish imparts a touch of smoky oak.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2010 Finley Vineyard Estate Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The pretty but powerful nose is like striking a gusher of black gold in a field of lavender, full of tar, violet and blueberry. Leather and deep purple fruit lead the palate, with charred meat savoriness, black pepper spice and plum skin tannins making a good case for this seven-acre vineyard that was planted in 1998.

title: Comartin 2011 The Porterhouse Syrah-Grenache (Central Coast)
description: This 90% Syrah and 10% Grenache blend, named as an ode to the winemaker's butcher-ancestors, begins with scents of blueberry crème brûlée with a spearmint glaze. The flavors are comparably light, with tarter blueberry, some licorice on the midpalate and a tannic finish.

title: Vina Robles 2013 Huerhuero Albariño (Paso Robles)
description: Yellow summer melon and green apple make for a crisp, clean, bright and beautiful nose. The palate is peachy, with a citrus and cinnamon-apple flavored finish, walking the fine, fun line between brisk austerity and fruity richness.

title: Trefethen 2012 Estate Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: Barrel-fermented , this nonetheless offers clean, crisp flavors of pear and pineapple on the palate. The fruit lingers through a medium-sized body that picks up steam on the finish, delving into richer notes of fig and lemon curd. The fruit is 100% estate.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2008 Test Pilot Thunderbolt P-47 Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Cigar box, spiced plums and wet tobacco give a serious scent profile to this half Syrah, half Cabernet Sauvignon blend. It's surprisingly light at first while dancing on the palate with plum soda flavors, then delivers grippy tannic weight. Pair with prime rib.

title: Cosa Obra 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A taste of Key lime and tonic unveil a vibrancy of aroma and high-acid flavor in this wine, additionally characterized by layers of crisp white peach and pineapple juice.

title: Goldschmidt 2009 Yoeman Vineyard Plus Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This 100% Cabernet Sauvignon is aged 43 months in new French oak. The oak is indeed dominant here, enveloping more subdued layers of savory leather, dark berry and cassis. Firm, substantial tannins hit on the back of the throat and coat the palate all the way through the long finish.

title: Midnight 2011 Nebula Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Brown dust, plum jam, red cherry and black tobacco power the nose on this medium-bodied Cab. It's alluring on the palate with dark fruit, mouthwatering spices and a crème brûlée sense to the whole package.

title: Muscardini 2010 Madrone Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Medium in weight and body, this offers juicy black cherry fruit around a core of dry tannins. The overall texture is soft enough to enjoy now, the finish savory in clove.
